title: Uniform (m)-condition and Strong Milnor fibrations
summary:
In this paper we study the Milnor fibrations associated to real analytic map
germs $\psi:(\mathbb{R}^{m},0) \to (\mathbb{R}^2,0)$ with isolated critical
point at $0\in \mathbb{R}^{m}$. The main result relates the existence of called
Strong Milnor fibrations with a transversality condition of a convenient family
of analytic varieties with isolated critical points at the origin $0\in
\mathbb{R}^{m}$, obtained by projecting the map germ $\psi$ in the family
$L_{-\theta}$ of all lines through the origin in the plane $\mathbb R^{2}.$

FIBRATIONS
RAIMUNDO N. ARAÚJO DOS SANTOS
Abstract. In this paper we study the Milnor fibrations associated to real analytic map germs ψ : (Rm , 0) → (R2 , 0) with isolated
critical point at 0 ∈ Rm . The main result relates the existence of
called Strong Milnor fibrations with a transversality condition of a
convenient family of analytic varieties with isolated critical points
at the origin 0 ∈ Rm , obtained by projecting the map germ ψ in
the family L−θ of all lines through the origin in the plane R2 .
